pages.title: Orbital Scan #0074
pages.text: $(bold)Subject: Acheronite Refinement Process$()$(br2)Acheronite shards are incredibly cold and incredibly useful, but they're raw. Unstable. You can't make armor out of frozen screaming crystal fragments. Well, you $(italic)can$(), but the results are... unpleasant.$(br2)The $(bold)Acheron Forge$() solves this. Orbital scans suggest geothermal heat can refine raw shards into $(bold)Refined Acheronite$() â€” a stable, workable material.$(br2)$(italic)This is theoretical. You're the field test. ORSA thanks you for your service. From orbit.$()

pages.title: Requirements
pages.text: The Acheron Forge needs two things:$(br2)$(li)$(bold)Depth:$() Must be placed below $(bold)Y=0$(). It draws power from geothermal heat. Surface placement will result in a very expensive paperweight.$(li)$(bold)Heat Source:$() A Geothermal Core must be within $(bold)8 blocks$(). No core, no refinement. The forge will helpfully display "No heat source nearby" to remind you of your failure.$(br2)Place an Acheronite Shard in the input slot. If conditions are met, the forge will process it into Refined Acheronite. Each shard takes a few seconds.$(br2)$(italic)ORSA Health Advisory: Do not lick the forge. We shouldn't have to transmit this, but here we are.$()

pages.title: Acheron Forge
pages.text: Obsidian frame, ice shards for the cooling matrix, and a Thermal Core for the heating element. Fire and ice in one box. ORSA engineering at its finest.
